definition: to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: He pillaged the country of its treasures and of its best people.
sentences.chinese: 他掠奪了這個國家的財富和百姓中的精英。

sentences.english: Thanks to demonization of Hinduism by British lootersand their evangelists.
sentences.chinese: 感謝英國掠奪者及其佈道者對印度教的妖魔化。

sentences.english: These camp robbers hae become habituated to campers as a food source.
sentences.chinese: 這些營地掠奪者已經慣於將野營者作爲一種食物來源。

sentences.english: That particular screenshot mentioned shows off a visceral fight between Marauders and Immortals.
sentences.chinese: 這張截屏展示了掠奪者和不朽者的激烈戰鬥。

sentences.english: Pripyat has since been looted and only images and architecture remain.
sentences.chinese: 普里皮亞季因此被掠奪，只有照片跟建築遺留了下來。

sentences.english: Today, many Burmese view China as a pillager of resources.
sentences.chinese: 如今，許多緬族人都把中國看做是一個資源掠奪者。

sentences.english: The town was pillaged by the invading army.
sentences.chinese: 入侵的軍隊將該城鎮掠奪一空。

sentences.english: Nineveh is torn, split and plundered!
sentences.chinese: 尼尼微是個被分裂和掠奪的地方。

sentences.english: THE ORDER -----No looting in shops. No honking and no overtaking on the roads.
sentences.chinese: 商店沒出現掠奪，路上也沒追趕與尖叫。

sentences.english: I'll go into some of the Marauder mechanics.
sentences.chinese: 我會談下掠奪者的結構。

sentences.english: A second candidate for the extractive-elite category is the public sector.
sentences.chinese: 另外一個可供掠奪性精英選擇的去向就是公共部門。

sentences.english: It is to be regretted that the word plunder is offensive.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，掠奪這個詞令人厭惡。

sentences.english: Allosaurus was the top predatory dinosaur of the late Jurassic period in North America.
sentences.chinese: 異龍是最大的掠奪性恐龍的晚侏羅紀期間在北美地區。

sentences.english: Growth is a cruel plunder, rob to naive, take pure.
sentences.chinese: 成長是一場殘忍的掠奪，搶去天真，奪走單純。

sentences.english: Faced with a precipice or a predator, the brain is biased to make certain decisions.
sentences.chinese: 面對懸崖或掠奪者，大腦做出的決定會有一定的不同。
這種算法被稱爲掠奪交易。

definition: to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
